title: Man 'grounded flights at airport' after taking stolen Cliff Richard cutout on plane
text:

Planes were 'grounded' at an airport in Portugal after a man smuggled a cardboard cutout of Cliiff Richard onto his flight back home.

Jeffrey Narraway hoped to take the printout of Sir Cliff to his local bowls club and set him up in the bar.

He carried the life-size figure onto his flight at Faro Airport after a fellow member of St Lawrence Bowls Team, in Ramsgate, Kent, pinched the cutout from duty free.

The group stole the item because a member of their club looks like the iconic singer.

(Image: Humphrey Nemar)

Mr Narraway, 59, told the Daily Star : “I was amazed we brought the airport to a stop, absolutely and totally amazed.

“We were out bowling in Portugal having a good time when on the way home we saw Sir Cliff in duty free.

“He came with us for a drink in the bar and when it was time to go I folded him up and walked him through. We got on the plane and I put him in the overhead locker."

The bowler said the group thought it would be 'funny' to take the hitmaker home with them.

(Image: Universal Images Group via Getty)

(Image: Humphrey Nemar)

However, passengers on Mr Narraway's flight were reportedly told that all of the airport's planes were grounded until the item was returned.

The pilot on the bowler's plane pledged there would be no consequences if Sir Cliff was returned immediately.

He immediately removed the cutout from his overhead locker and dropped it off at the cockpit.

Mr Narraway said the cabin crew were in fits of giggles, while the pilot shook his hand and told him it was the funniest moment of his career.
description: A British bowls club tried to fly home with Sir Cliff Richard's cardboard counterpart, but Portuguese officials failed to see the funny side
